document_data.mainbody: '''Ir'revrykal''' was a powerful and strongly enchanted [[greatsword]], which could only be wielded by an [[evil]] [[paladin]].
document_data.Description: The two-handed sword was dark in appearance and "radiated evil" from a distance. Circular [[gith language|tir'su]] runes were inscribed across the serrated blade, spelling out its name, meaning "pain-servant".
document_data.Powers: The Unholy Reaver made its wielder immune to ''[[charm]]'' spells, but its most powerful feature was a half-chance to [[dispel magic]] on a creature with every strike. Only strong characters could wield such an item.

History.Legendary history:
Legend has it that Ir'revrykal was forged by the [[githyanki]] [[wizard]]-smith [[Ir'mlar]],<ref group="note">The name of the creator of Ir'revrykal shares similarities with the name of the greatsword itself: "Ir'mlar" translates to "pain-mlar", a mlar being a githyanki spellcaster who specializes in construction, ''i.e.'', a wizard-smith. Both the ''mlar'' and the ''servant'' are associated with the concept of ''pain''. hundreds of years before the 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. It was rumored to have been smithed in the darkened caverns below the city of [[Tu'narath]], an unholy city that floated on the [[Astral Plane]] upon "the One in the Void", a long-dead deity.

To craft the sword, the [[mlar]] used the bones of the One in the Void, an unknown substance to the [[Prime Material plane]]. The wizard-smith then imbued the weapon with an evil entity claimed to be a prince of the lower plane of [[Carceri]]. Some claimed, however, that the greatsword contained the One in the Void's spirit, which had been banished to within the blade for crimes committed against other gods aeons ago.
